prompt_blocks.text:
You will be shown several images captured during a robotic manipulation task.
Each image comes with a description of the camera position from which it was taken.
Please use this information to help answer the following question.
Image 1: This image was taken from a fixed camera at the center, facing the manipulation scene.
Image 3:
Image 2:

The center image (fix_center) represents the agent's viewpoint.
The left and right images are from cameras positioned on the left and right sides of the agent.

Based on the agent's perspective in the center image (fix_center), identify which image represents the right side.
Consider the agent's orientation and the relative positions of objects in the scene.
Which image number shows the right side relative to the agent's viewpoint?
Refer to images as image 1 to 3 (i.e., first input image -> image 1, third input image -> image 3)

You will be shown several images captured during a robotic manipulation task.
Each image comes with a description of the camera position from which it was taken.
Please use this information to help answer the following question.
Image 3:
Image 2:
Image 1: This image was taken from a fixed camera at the center, facing the manipulation scene.

The center image (fix_center) represents the agent's viewpoint.
The left and right images are from cameras positioned on the left and right sides of the agent.

The agent's viewpoint is established by the center image (fix_center).
From this central reference, locate which image number shows the right side.
Consider the agent's orientation and spatial context.
Which image number corresponds to the right side relative to the center?

You will be shown several images captured during a robotic manipulation task.
Each image comes with a description of the camera position from which it was taken.
Please use this information to help answer the following question.
Image 4: View: fix_right_2
Image 2: View: fix_left_1
Image 1: View: fix_left_2
Image 3: View: fix_right_1

These images were captured during the same robotic manipulation sequence.
One image has a timing issue - it was taken at a different moment than the others.
Look for inconsistencies in the scene, such as changes in lighting, object positions, or robot movements.
Which image number (1-4) shows a different time point?

You will be shown several images captured during a robotic manipulation task.
Each image comes with a description of the camera position from which it was taken.
Please use this information to help answer the following question.
Scenario 1:
Image 1: This image was taken from a fixed camera at the center, facing the manipulation scene.
Image 2: This image was taken from a fixed camera on the left side, observing the manipulation task.
Image 3: This image was taken from a fixed camera on the right side, observing the manipulation task.
Image 4: This image was captured from a wrist-mounted camera on the robot's arm.
Scenario 2:
Image 1:
Image 2:
Image 3:
Image 4:

Scenario 1 contains Image 2 captured from the fix_left camera.
Your task is to find the matching image in Scenario 2 that shows the identical camera perspective.
Which image number in Scenario 2 represents the same fix_left view as Image 2 in Scenario 1?

You will be shown several images captured during a robotic manipulation task.
Each image comes with a description of the camera position from which it was taken.
Please use this information to help answer the following question.
Scenario 1:
Image 1: This image was taken from a fixed camera at the center, facing the manipulation scene.
Image 2: This image was captured from a wrist-mounted camera on the robot's left arm.
Image 3: This image was captured from a wrist-mounted camera on the robot's right arm.
Scenario 2:
Image 1:
Image 2:
Image 3:

Both scenarios display similar manipulation tasks from multiple viewpoints in different sequences.
Scenario 1's Image 1 represents the fix_center camera position.
Find the equivalent image in Scenario 2 that shows the identical spatial perspective.
Select the image number in Scenario 2 that corresponds to the fix_center view.

You will be shown several images captured during a robotic manipulation task.
Each image comes with a description of the camera position from which it was taken.
Please use this information to help answer the following question.
Image 1: This image was taken from a fixed camera at the center, facing the manipulation scene.
Image 3: This image was captured from a wrist-mounted camera on the robot's right arm.
Image 2: This image was captured from a wrist-mounted camera on the robot's left arm.

You are viewing multiple images from a robotic task execution.
Most images are synchronized, but one is temporally misaligned.
Examine the visual cues carefully: shadows, object states, robot arm positions, or environmental changes.
Identify the image that doesn't belong to the same time frame as the others.

The agent's viewpoint is established by the center image (fix_center).

Which image number corresponds to the right side relative to the center?

You will be shown several images captured during a robotic manipulation task.
Each image comes with a description of the camera position from which it was taken.

You are examining two scenarios from different sequences of the same robotic task.
In Scenario 1, Image 1 shows the fix_left_2 perspective.
Locate the corresponding image in Scenario 2 that captures the same camera angle.
Which image in Scenario 2 matches the fix_left_2 view from Scenario 1?

You will be shown several images captured during a robotic manipulation task.
Each image comes with a description of the camera position from which it was taken.
Please use this information to help answer the following question.
Image 1: This image was taken from a fixed camera on the right side, observing the manipulation task.
Image 3: This image was captured from a wrist-mounted camera on the robot's arm.
Image 2: This image was taken from a fixed camera on the left side, observing the manipulation task.

These images document a single robotic operation from multiple camera angles.
One image contains a temporal anomaly - it was captured at a different point in the sequence.
Analyze the visual evidence for timing inconsistencies.
Select the image number that exhibits temporal desynchronization.

Select the image number that represents the right side from the agent's perspective.
